ygData.subject: Re: Operation Black Tower
ygData.msgSnippet: Rat Trap swallows hard.  He knew they couldn t go any closser.  Ulp.  Umm, we better think this over before we go any closser Windlord...  Things don t look

Rat Trap swallows hard.  He knew they couldn't go any closser.

" Ulp.  Umm=
, we better think this over before we go any closser Windlord...  Things do=
n't look so good down there...  Those are seekers, and one slip from us, we=
're as good as jet kill."

From his observation post, Quickstride could sen=
se the worry in Rodimus's voice.  He too was worried and continues to keep =
his ears and eyes peeled in all directions.  He paws his left front hoof.

=
" Just what I was thinkn' Rodimus.  I wonder if they got tipped off about o=
ur plan of action..  Slippery stuff when there's a mole involved that we do=
n't know about.."

From where Night Shift was, he could not see the seekers=
, yet, just by his radar systems, he could definitely tell that there was a=
 flying brigade around the fortress.  He slowly comes to a stop.

"Oh snap.=
  Radar's teamn' with enemy forces.  Tucson do ya copy?  We got trouble."

=
Tucson gets the message.

"I copy, what's your status?"

Night Shift backs =
into an area, conveniently hidden by fallen boulders into a cave like struc=
ture, just large enough for him to park in.  He douses his headlights.

" B=
ad news, my radar's just picked up a sentry around the fortress spire, acco=
rdn' ta the readings, they're seekers.  Rat Trap'n Windlord aint' gonna get=
 too close ta that tower.  If they do, they're as good as prisoners."

Tucs=
on thinks.

" I certainly do not wish to risk their lives...  I will inform=
 them immediately of your findings."

He turns on his com link to Rat Trap.=


"Rat Trap, do you read me?  This is Tucson Prime, over."

Rat Trap gets t=
he message.

"I read ya Wheels.  And I don't like what I see down there..."=


Tucson now turns his direction toward the sound of his sonars.  He now pi=
cks up multiple pings as he too, slowly moves into position.

" You are awa=
re of the pending danger, good.  If you can not enter the fortress, we will=
 find alternate ways of doing so.  Do not risk yourselves needlessly."

Rat=
 Trap nodds.

"Gotchya, but, Wheels, we really do owe ya one.  If it weren'=
t for you, none of us would be out here fightn' for what we believe in."

T=
ucson pauses.

" Be careful my friends, you are far too valuable to lose."
=

Night Shift remains parked.

"This is as far as I go for now.  Unless thos=
e seekers are diverted, we can't do scrap."

He turns to acknowledge Kup.  =
Straight Shot looks down to Night Shift from inside Kup's cab.

"I got an i=
dea.  It's a long shot, no pun intended but it might work. I am equipped wi=
th long range equipment.  What if Kup used me as a cross bow, to take out s=
ome of those seekers, create a diversion so that way Windlord and Rat Trap =
could make it inside?"

Night Shift spins a tire.

"I dunno, sounds risky..=
. What if they barrel after us?  I ain't a speedster."

Straight Shot looks=
 at him.

" It's worth a shot.  Let's run it by Tucson."

Tucson now reciev=
es a message from Straight Shot.  He ponders the daring move.

"Hmm, that w=
ould work as a diversion but it's extremely risky...  But nothing we've nev=
er dealth with before..  All right, perhaps it is necesary to make a move. =
 Straight Shot, Kup, I want you to position yourselves as best you can.  Ku=
p, take robot mode, Straight Shot, cross bow mode, and program your traject=
ory settings to long range.  Be sure to conceal yourselves amply.   Night S=
hift, I'll need you to remain in vehicle mode, for a quick getaway.  Rodimu=
s, Quickstride, it has now come to my attention that unless a diversion is =
executed, Rat Trap and Windlord may not make it into the fortress safely.  =
Straight Shot is going to provide the diversion along with Kup's help.  Be =
prepared, once this diversion is in place, we may need you two to get into =
battle mode to fend off any seeker that tries to attempt an attack on the A=
rk.  I know these changes are sudden, but unfortunately, there is a lot of =
uncertainty in this mission.  All right, battle stations everyone, things a=
re about to get rocky."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <sup=
ercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> As most of the crew waits at the Ark, or at leas=
t somewhat behind, Windlord
> and Ratrap begin the journey towards Hydras' =
black tower. Most of the trip
> is largely uneventful. The duo passed over =
rivers, streams, mountains and
> even an ocean to get to their destination.=

> 
> As they close in to perhaps within 50 kilometers they can see the tal=
l ebony
> colored spire that is the dark tower, jutting out of a large lake=
 of glowing
> red hot magma like some dark fist of defiance; its dark well =
armored surface
> glinting in the sun like well shined onyx.
> 
> As they g=
et closer, perhaps within 20 kilometers, they can see dots swooping
> aroun=
d the tower looking something like birds of prey over a rabbit in the
> fie=
lds. However the fields themselves are broken lands, rocks and stones
> jut=
ting out of a nearly featureless landscape.
> 
> As Windlord and Rat Trap g=
et a little closer they can see that the dots are
> not birds at all, but t=
hey are jets, each one of them an exact replica of
> Scourge! Five of them =
sweep through the skies their movements are a well
> orchestrated search pa=
ttern. Either they were looking for something, or
> keeping an sensor open =
for anyone approaching. It was obvious that to
> approach any further in th=
e open would risk detection.
> 
> *     *     *     *     *     *     *    =
 *     *
> 
> Meanwhile back at the Ark Rodimus nodded at Quickstride, his =
face obviously
> troubled. There was a part of him that knew that he needed=
 to be here at the
> Ark to protect it, yet another part of him wanted to b=
e there where the
> action was.
> 
> He glanced at his screens, "I don't kn=
ow quickstride, maybe they do know of
> our plan already and are just waiti=
ng for us to fall into a trap they have
> set."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>
